column4: Is there ANY way to locate 125GB of missing unallocated space???????????
this os is so freakin weak
thats what I'm trying to figure out is if there is a way to repair a damaged partition table
I swear partition magic fucked it all up
is that 125GB lost forever?
try Parted Magic.. it is gparted version of Partition magic.. and since its linux.. its better than partition magic
Make another boot CD or boot USB using Parted Magic.. its done wonders for me.. it'll even mount partitions to retrieve data from it..
but how do I burn the files to CD with that boot disk
can you run the Ubuntu LiveCD?!!!
yes
go online.. http://partedmagic.com/wiki/PartedMagic.php  and create either a boot CD or a boot USB drive.. you should be able to do that within the LiveCD
Try Parted Magic.. if the missing partition ended up being just a hidden partition.. Parted Magic can mount it and you can copy it to either a USB drive or another partition.
can parted magic be used as a boot image?
It is meant to be used as a boot image.. an it'll load itself onto the memory so that you can eject the CD after you boot it up..
liveCD or parted magic?

LiveCD means a fully operational Operating System running from a CD without writing anything to the hard drive, and using the CD as its resource to read files from. Parted Magic is just like that, except that if you have enough memory in your PC it'll load the whole CD into memory, so you can use the CD-Drive for other purposes.
thx I'll try that
top.. and sorry its not VCORE.. just Core..
still around?
seems like the problem is worse than I thought.. sorry was away for a while.. but i'm glad to see you've recovered your files.. or atleast see them.. :-)
'su' will log you on as a super user.. basically root
type /msg nickserve register password
type /msg nickserv register password
yes you are..
